title.narrative: Feasibility Study - Rwanda: Kigali Innovation Smart City, through Enterprise - United States Unknown

description.narrative: A USTDA grant to the Rwanda Development Board is funding a feasibility study (Study) that would assess (i) various options for deployment of smart city solutions at Kigali Innovation City, a planned mixed-use development intended to serve as a hub for the technology industry in Kigali, and (ii) the feasibility of further deployments of smart city technologies throughout Rwanda.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Desk Study - U.S.-ACEF Amahoro Energy Small Hydro Projects, through CJ Aron Associates, Inc.

description.narrative: This $5,000 desk study reviewed a proposal for a feasibility study to evaluate the technical, financial, and other aspects of four small hydro expansion, rehabilitation, and development projects in Musanze District, Northern Province, Rwanda.

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Feasibility Study - U.S.-ACEF Amahoro Energy Small Hydro Projects, through Government of Rwanda

description.narrative: A USTDA grant of $675,000 to the Rwandan energy developer Amahoro Energy Ltd. is supporting a feasibility study to evaluate the company's plans to develop a greenfield run-of-river hydropower plant and upgrade expansion of five existing small hydropower sites located in Rwanda's northeast Musanze District (Project). The Project would be developed in two phases over a two-year period and would install a combined 11.45 megawatts (MW) of new generation capacity. If implemented, the Project would directly support Rwanda's Economic Development and Poverty Reduction Strategy and national Energy Sector Strategic Plan by increasing renewable energy generation and helping to electrify over 22,500 households, businesses, and the Shiyira Hospital. The feasibility study is being undertaken on a sole-source basis by the U.S. engineering firm Knight Piesold & Co. (Contractor). The Grantee has agreed to share costs of the total feasibility study cost of $800,000.

title.narrative: Technical Assistance - Banque Nationale du Rwanda ICT Modernization, through Government of Rwanda

description.narrative: This $547,000 grant to Rwanda's National Bank, Banque Nationale Du Rwanda (BNR), for technical assistance (TA) assisted BNR in building the technical capabilities to provide real-time cash balance information to policymakers. These capabilities will build capacity for more effective fiscal policy formulation and budget execution at the Ministry of Finance. Specifically, this activity will improve the Government of Rwanda's cash management and reduce unnecessary borrowing, enable more accurate cash forecasting and budget implementation, tighten financial control of ongoing long-term projects, and provide greater transparency and less opportunity for misuse of funds.

title.narrative: Desk Study - Desk Study Review: Banque Nationale Du Rwnada ICT Modernization, through Global Resources, Inc.

description.narrative: This $6,000 desk study reviews a proposal for an addendum to the Banque National du Rwanda (BNR) ICT Modernization Technical Assistance (USTDA 2010-11009A). The addendum would provide BNR with assistance in evaluating proposals for its core banking and enterprise resource planning RFP's, as well as assistance with contract negotiations.

These capabilities will build capacity for more effective fiscal policy formulation and budget execution at the Ministry of Finance.
